io.github.noeppi_noeppi.libx.data.provider

Class BlockLootProviderBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.noeppi_noeppi.libx.data.provider.BlockLootProviderBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.minecraft.data.IDataProvider

    public abstract class BlockLootProviderBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements net.minecraft.data.IDataProvider
    A base class for block loot provider. When overriding this you should call the customLootTable methods in setup to adjust the loot tables. Every block of you mod that is left untouched will get a default loot table.

    • Method Detail

      • customLootTable

        protected void customLootTable(net.minecraft.block.Block block)
        The given block will not be processed by this provider. Useful when you want to create the loot table manually.

      • setup

        protected abstract void setup()

      • copyNBT

        public BlockLootProviderBase.LootModifier copyNBT(java.lang.String... tags)
        Creates a loot modifier that copies NBT-Data from a tile entity into the dropped item. Use this with one of the drops methods.
        Parameters:
        tags - The toplevel tags of the tile entity to be copied.

      • copyProperties

        public BlockLootProviderBase.LootModifier copyProperties(net.minecraft.state.Property<?>... properties)
        Creates a loot modifier that copies properties from a blockstate into the dropped item. Use this with one of the drops methods.
        Parameters:
        properties - The properties of the blockstate to be copied.

      • drops

        public void drops(net.minecraft.block.Block b,
                  boolean silk,
                  net.minecraft.item.ItemStack... drops)
        Method to add a custom loot table for a block.
        Parameters:
        b - The block to add the loot table to.
        silk - Whether the block can be mined with silk touch to drop itself.
        drops - A list of stacks that will all be dropped if silk touch is false or the block is mined without silk touch.

      • drops

        public void drops(net.minecraft.block.Block b,
                  boolean silk,
                  net.minecraft.loot.LootEntry.Builder<?>... loot)
        Method to add a custom loot table for a block.
        Parameters:
        b - The block to add the loot table to.
        silk - Whether the block can be mined with silk touch to drop itself.
        loot - A list of loot factories that will all be applied if silk touch is false or the block is mined without silk touch.

      • drops

        public void drops(net.minecraft.block.Block b,
                  boolean silk,
                  BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory... loot)
        Method to add a custom loot table for a block.
        Parameters:
        b - The block to add the loot table to.
        silk - Whether the block can be mined with silk touch to drop itself.
        loot - A list of loot factories that will all be applied if silk touch is false or the block is mined without silk touch.

      • drops

        public void drops(net.minecraft.block.Block b,
                  BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory... loot)
        Method to add a custom loot table for a block.
        Parameters:
        b - The block to add the loot table to.
        loot - A list of loot factories that will all be applied.

      • drops

        public void drops(net.minecraft.block.Block b,
                  BlockLootProviderBase.SilkModifier silk,
                  BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory... loot)
        Method to add a custom loot table for a block.
        Parameters:
        b - The block to add the loot table to.
        silk - Either null in which case no special handling of silk touch is done or a LootModifier that can modify the stack after mining with silk touch.
        loot - A list of loot factories that are used when silk ouch is either null or the block is mined without silk touch. All of them will be applied.

      • item

        public BlockLootProviderBase.StandaloneLootFactory item()
        Gets a standalone loot factory to always drop the block as item.

      • silk

        public BlockLootProviderBase.SilkModifier silk(BlockLootProviderBase.GenericLootModifier modifier)
        Turns a generic loot modifier into a silk modifier. This exists to reduce ambiguity. A silk modifier does not extend GenericLootModifier for this reason.

      • noSilk

        public BlockLootProviderBase.SilkModifier noSilk()
        Gets a new silk modifier that means: No special silk touch behaviour.

      • repeat

        public BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory repeat(BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory factory,
                                                int times)
        Repeats a loot factory a fixed amount of times.

        public net.minecraft.loot.conditions.ILootCondition.IBuilder or(net.minecraft.loot.conditions.ILootCondition.IBuilder condition)
        Joins conditions with OR.

      • all

        public BlockLootProviderBase.AllLootBuilder all()
        A builder for loot groups where every member is selected.

      • group

        public BlockLootProviderBase.GroupLootBuilder group()
        Minecraft does not seem to have a loot builder for groups. So here you have one. This will select only one element per roll.

      • sequence

        public BlockLootProviderBase.SequenceLootBuilder sequence()
        Minecraft does not seem to have a loot builder for sequences. So here you have one. This will select only one element per roll.

      • combine

        public net.minecraft.loot.LootEntry.Builder<?> combine(net.minecraft.loot.LootEntry.Builder<?>... loot)
        Combines the given loot builders into one. (All loot builders will be applied).

      • combine

        public BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory combine(BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory... loot)
        Combines the given loot factories into one. (All loot factories will be applied).

      • random

        public net.minecraft.loot.LootEntry.Builder<?> random(net.minecraft.loot.LootEntry.Builder<?>... loot)
        Combines the given loot builders into one. (One loot builder will be applied).

      • random

        public BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory random(BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory... loot)
        Combines the given loot factories into one. (One loot factory will be applied).

      • first

        public net.minecraft.loot.LootEntry.Builder<?> first(net.minecraft.loot.LootEntry.Builder<?>... loot)
        Combines the given loot builders into one. Only the first matching builder is applied.

      • first

        public BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory first(BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory... loot)
        Combines the given loot factories into one. Only the first matching factory is applied.

      • whileMatch

        public net.minecraft.loot.LootEntry.Builder<?> whileMatch(net.minecraft.loot.LootEntry.Builder<?>... loot)
        Combines the given loot builders into one. From all the loot entries until the first one not matching, one is selected.

      • whileMatch

        public BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory whileMatch(BlockLootProviderBase.LootFactory... loot)
        Combines the given loot factories into one. From all the loot factories until the first one not matching, one is selected.

      • stack

        public BlockLootProviderBase.WrappedLootEntry stack(net.minecraft.util.IItemProvider item)
        A loot factory for a specific item.

      • stack

        public BlockLootProviderBase.WrappedLootEntry stack(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack stack)
        Tries to create the best possible representation of stack in a loot entry.

      • defaultBehavior

        @Nullable
protected net.minecraft.loot.LootTable.Builder defaultBehavior(net.minecraft.block.Block b)
        Creates a default loot table for the given block. Can be overridden to alter default behaviour. Should return null if no loot table should be generated.

      • needsLootTable

        protected boolean needsLootTable(net.minecraft.block.BlockState state)
        Returns whether this block state needs a loot table. If all blockstates of a block don't need a loot table, defaultBehavior will return null for that block. Can be overridden to alter the behaviour.
